title: Thinking It Through - purpose of text

content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the author’s primary purpose in this passage?

choices.label: Using a discussion of an accessible topic to introduce readers to the distinctive way philosophers approach questions
Presenting relevant arguments for and against the proposition that computers can be intelligent so that readers can draw their own conclusions about the topic
Demonstrating that philosophy can be used to address issues that are relevant to people’s daily lives
Arguing in favor of the uniqueness of human intelligence while acknowledging the ways that technology can be used to enhance this intelligence

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe components of the rhetorical situation - the exigence, audience, purpose, context, and message.
